alert.note: Alert for Polk; Trinity (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 23 at 9:30PM CST until January 24 at 12:30AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: The National Weather Service in League City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Polk County in southeastern Texas... Southeastern Trinity County in southeastern Texas... * Until 1230 AM CST. * At 930 PM CST, emergency management and media reported flooding due to heavy rainfall in Crystal Lakes Subdivision in Polk County. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Livingston, Onalaska, Corrigan, Goodrich, Seven Oaks, West Livingston, Lake Livingston State Park, Leggett and Moscow. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
